agency_name: COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM, INC. OF WESTERN INDIANA
agency_desc: A community action agency that works collaboratively with community partners to promote economic self-sufficiency by removing the causes and conditions of poverty through services, support, and education.
site_name: COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM OF WESTERN INDIANA - BENTON COUNTY
service_description: Provides weatherization services for income eligible homeowners and renters at no cost to them. Services may include but are not limited to; general air sealing, insulation upgrades, heating equipment replacement, and baseload energy consumption reduction.
site_details: Call or visit the website to apply.
site_eligibility: Living in Benton County -- Household income at or below 200% Federal Poverty Guidelines

agency_desc: A nonprofit, faith-based organization that provides outreach assistance to those in need, including limited financial assistance.
service_description: Provides limited financial assistance for rent, mortgage, utilities, healthcare, clothing, food, and lodging/motels to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Tues, Wed, and Thurs 8:30am-5pm; by appointment only
Tues, Wed, and Thurs 8:30am-5pm; by appointment only
Tues, Wed, and Thurs 8:30am-5pm; by appointment only
Tues, Wed, and Thurs 8:30am-5pm; by appointment only
Tues, Wed, and Thurs 8:30am-5pm; by appointment only
Tues, Wed, and Thurs 8:30am-5pm; by appointment only
Tues, Wed, and Thurs 8:30am-5pm; by appointment only
Tues, Wed, and Thurs 8:30am-5pm; by appointment only
Tues, Wed, and Thurs 8:30am-5pm; by appointment only
site_eligibility: Living in Benton County -- Financial need (based on assessment)

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that partners with local human service organizations, businesses, and government agencies to support and strengthen the community.
service_description: Provides college scholarships for students in Benton County.
site_details: Visit bentoncf.org/scholarships to apply for scholarships.
site_eligibility: Living in Benton County -- Graduating high school by June 2023

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials, including juvenile and family cases, in Benton County.
site_details: Varies; cases are generally initiated through the prosecutor's office, private attorneys -- individuals representing themselves.
site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $6,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500. In Benton County, the Circuit Court handles small claims cases.
site_details: Call or walk in to the County Clerk's office.
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $6,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Benton County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Benton County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Benton County

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Provides probation services for the Benton County Circuit Court, including supervising juvenile and adult offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Through the courts; call for details.
site_eligibility: Offenders assigned to probation by the Benton County Circuit Court

agency_desc: Coordinates emergency management programs and response measures in Benton County.
service_description: Responds during a disaster or large-scale emergency in Benton County, assists with the recovery efforts afterwards, and takes steps to prevent or lessen the effects of future disasters. (Offers sandbags to Benton County households during times of flooding.)
site_details: Call for information. For emergency assistance, call 9-1-1.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Benton County

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all births and deaths that occur in the County and provides certified copies of birth and death certificates for fixed fees.
site_details: Walk in, download application from website, or call to have application sent by mail. -- Bring or mail in completed application, required documentation, and payment. -- Indiana birth certificates and death records may also be requested online at www.vitalchek.com; this service is offered by a third-party and is not directly affiliated with the health department.
site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
site_name: BENTON COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT - PATIENT CARE SERVICES
service_description: Offers limited adult vaccinations, including tetanus (Tdap), hepatitis A, and hepatitis B.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Age 19 or older -- Living in Benton County

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Files, modifies, and enforces court-ordered child support cases in Benton County.
site_details: To apply for child support or request child support enforcement or modification, call the child support office to schedule an appointment. -- For payment information, call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8:30am-noon and 1pm-4:30pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
Mon-Fri 8:30am-noon and 1pm-4:30pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: To File for Child Support Assistance: Living in Benton County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library for residents of Benton County. Circulates books, eBooks, periodicals, audio books, and DVDs. Provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services.
site_schedule: Mon, Wed, and Fri 9am-5pm; Tues and Thurs 9am-8pm; Sat 10am-2pm
Mon, Wed, and Fri 9am-5pm; Tues and Thurs 9am-8pm; Sat 10am-2pm
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living in Benton County.

agency_desc: A nonprofit community center providing fitness activities and lending of medical equipment for residents of Benton County.
service_description: Provides exercise equipment to persons of all ages in Benton County.
site_details: Call or walk in to use equipment, or for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides senior activities and charitable outreach for older adults.
service_description: Offers activities for older adults, including special interest classes, and social activities.
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_eligibility: Age 55 or older

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Benton County.
service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_schedule: Clerk's Office: Mon-Fri 8:30am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in Benton County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Benton County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Benton County

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call to make an appointment.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Benton County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Benton County, including performing the following duties: Controls, maintains, and supervises county property -- Audits and authorizes claims against the county -- Receives bids for and authorizes county contracts -- Performs certain election functions -- Handles appeals of township trustee decisions
site_details: Call for assistance.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8:30am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Tues 8:15am
Office: Mon-Fri 8:30am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Tues 8:15am
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a clothing pantry.
service_description: Offers a faith-based, 12-step program to anyone seeking peer support as they work through issues related to any type of addiction.
site_details: Call for more information.
site_schedule: Church Office: Tues-Fri 10am-4pm -- Group Meeting: Wed 6pm
Church Office: Tues-Fri 10am-4pm -- Group Meeting: Wed 6pm
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a clothing pantry.
site_name: FOWLER UNITED METHODIST CHURCH - HIS KLOSET TOO
service_description: Provides adult clothing, shoes, coats, underwear, and socks for Benton County persons in need. Household items such as bedding, blankets, and dishes are generally available.
site_details: Walk in; fill out card with name and address.
site_eligibility: Benton County adults -- Clothing: Can visit twice monthly if needed -- Underwear/Socks: Every 6 months

agency_desc: A farmers market program that officers locally grown foods and fresh produce in Benton County.
service_description: Sells local produce, fresh meats, baked goods, and handcrafted items to the community. Select vendors at this market accept Senior and WIC Farmers Market Nutrition Program checks for qualifying food items.
taxonomy_name: Farmers Markets Accepting Nutrition Program Vouchers
nameLevel4: Farmers Markets Accepting Nutrition Program Vouchers
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: BENTON COMMUNITY FOOD AND SERVICE CO-OP
agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing charitable outreach services, including a community-based food co-op.
site_name: BENTON COMMUNITY FOOD AND SERVICE CO-OP
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Call ahead 45 minutes before arrival. -- Requires either volunteer participation in the co-op or membership fee; number of hours depends on household size.
site_eligibility: Living in Benton County or in the Benton Community School District -- Age 18 or older -- Receiving some type of government assistance (Medicaid, WIC, SNAP, TANF, or EAP) -- Limit one membership per household

agency_desc: Provides maintenance services on public roads and streets.
service_description: Maintains county roadways in Benton County, including patching, paving, snow removal, and drainage along roadways.
site_details: Call for information or to report a problem. To report urgent problems after hours, call 9-1-1 or Benton County dispatch. www.bentoncounty.in.gov/highway
site_eligibility: Open (limited to county roads and properties in Benton County)

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing a variety of mental health services, including a crisis line, inpatient and outpatient services, and substance abuse services.
service_description: Offers outpatient treatment for adults and youth experiencing a mental health issue or psychiatric disorder, such as anger management, anxiety, attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), bi-polar disorder, depression, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), or schizophrenia. Services include an initial assessment as well as individual, group, couples, and/or family counseling. Case management, psychiatric medication services, and home- and community-based services are available to eligible clients receiving treatment at this center.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for information or to a schedule an appointment. -- Walk in for emergency assessment or crisis intervention.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- Crisis Line: Daily 24 hours
Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- Crisis Line: Daily 24 hours
Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- Crisis Line: Daily 24 hours
Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- Crisis Line: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Open (minimum age served determined by individual assessment)

agency_desc: A government agency that provides household recycling and hazardous waste collection and education and information about recycling, reusing, and reducing environmental hazards.
service_description: Maintains drop-off sites around Benton County for collecting recyclables including: corrugated cardboard and box board, glass, numbers one and two plastics, aluminum, tin, and steel beverage and food cans, newspapers, and magazines
site_details: Walk in, email, call, or visit the website for information.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 7:30am-3:30pm -- Drop Off: Varies by site
Mon-Fri 7:30am-3:30pm -- Drop Off: Varies by site
site_eligibility: Residential households in the county

agency_desc: Provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card:  Living in the town of Oxford or Oak Grove Township

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Benton Couny.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime prevention, and criminal investigation services and administers county correctional facilities in Benton County. Operates a 24-hour dispatch service for police officers, firefighters, and medics (ambulances) in Benton County. A ten-digit dispatch number is provided for nonemergency dispatch calls. For emergency assistance, persons should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police, fire, or medical assistance. For nonemergency requests or reports, call the office during normal business hours. nonemergency dispatch number.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Benton County
